fields.description: I just wanted to use git blame on a specific line in a specific file (getting to that file was hard, why is there no file browser?), and finding that line was cumbersome: I had to open it with another editor to find the line number and scroll to it manually, could you please add a search function to this view? And maybe a "go to line" function?
fields.summary: Search in git blame

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

A user is trying to add their Bitbucket/GitHub account in SourceTree, via the menu {{View >> Show Hosted Repositories}} and then {{Edit accounts... >> Add}}.

If they want to add an account that has 2FA enabled, the following error message appears:
 Bitbucket account:  !Screen Shot 2016-11-22 at 08.55.53.png|thumbnail! 
 GitHub account:   !Screen Shot 2016-11-22 at 09.18.38.png|thumbnail!

This error does not inform the user about the reason that log in is failing.
h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the error message to inform the user that 2FA is the reason that login is failing.
 Possibly, add a suggestion they use App passwords/Access tokens instead.
h3. Why this is important

The user is not informed of reason for the failed login, and does not know what steps to take to successfully add their account.
fields.summary: Improve error message when the user adds an account with 2FA

fields.description: My collegue created a new Atlassian Account for Source tree. The mail verification fails due to missing server behind the image link. How is to proceed? Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Mail verification fails
Some bug is present!

fields.description:
I selected File Status because I wanted to get a log/blame for a specific file.

Given it was taking so long to populate the file lists (I'd changed the "Show only pending" to "show all"), I typed a partial filename into the "search" text field.

source tree crashed.

Here is the stack trace:

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
 at SourceTree.View.Container.WorkingCopySplitFileListContainerView.DelayedSearchInvoke(String textWhenQueued) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\SourceTree.Ui.FileListContainer.Split.Wpf\View\Container\WorkingCopySplitFileListContainerView.xaml.cs:line 153
 at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherTimer.FireTick(Object unused)
 at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
 at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed when filtering incomplete File Status

fields.description:
GIT Flow was working in 1.9.6.1, but seems broken in 1.9.6.2, despite the release notes not indicating any changes to this functionality.

*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Add a repo to SourceTree that has not been initialized with GIT flow.
2. Ensure that the repo has only a `master` branch.
3. Create a new branch called "test/master" based on the same commit as `master`.
4. Click on the GIT Flow button to initialize GIT Flow.
5. Enter "test/" as a prefix to every field, as follows:
– Production branch: test/master
– Development branch: test/develop
– Feature branch prefix: test/feature/
– Release branch prefix: test/release/
– Hotfix branch prefix: test/hotfix/
6. Click "OK"
7. Click on the option to "Show Full Output".

*Expected Results*
 * GIT Flow is configured to use the specified branches.
 * A "test/develop" branch is created at the same commit as "test/master".

*Actual Results*
 * The log output indicates "Using default branch names", and seems to suggest that none of the custom branches are being respected.
 * The "test/develop" branch is never created.
 * Attempting to complete a feature causes it to be merged directly into master.
fields.summary: GIT Flow Init with custom prefixes does not create `develop` branch
branches with a comma in it are happily created, but cannot be switched to

fields.description:
I merged 2 branches which generated a lot of conflict files (about 180). After handling all of them I proceeded to the commit dialog, but it seems that with the whole list of conflicted file the Commit button is hidden.

I used minor severity because there is a simple workaround, using Ctrl+Enter to execute the commit.

The problem is easily reproducible: create a multi-line text as commit message, adding as many lines are needed to consume the available window height (basing on the size of your source tree)

In this example I added as many lines as leaving partially visible the commit button, to understand the behaviour

!image-2016-11-21-11-23-56-560.png!
fields.summary: Commit button is hidden with long commit message

fields.description:
After merging 2 branches, I got conflict on a file.
 * In one branch the file has been modified
 * In the other branch the files has been removed

Using
{code:java}
Resolve Using "Theirs"
{code}
I'm trying to promote the second branch, the file need to be deleted.

 

But using that function I'm getting this error:

!image-2016-11-21-10-36-18-635.png!

Issue @2059 or @2336 or @6442 seems to be similar to this one, I opened a new one because those one seems to be stucked without any update.
fields.summary: Locked files during conflicts resolving for deleted file

fields.description: SourceTree occasionally crashes when comitting or pushing. It happens randomly but regularly (e.g. maybe on average once every hour of regular use). Callstack attached. It seems like it might only happen after regular use.
fields.summary: Crash when committing or pushing

This only happens if I have enabled 'Always Display Full Console Output' in Tools-->Options-->General.

fields.description:
*git* working fine from *Command Prompt*
 But *failing* to be called from *SourceTree*
 For some reason SourceTree looking not in git *PATH*, but in *\git\..\cmd\git.exe*

Screenshots attached
fields.summary: SourceTree looking for system git.exe under cmd folder (but there are no one)

fields.description:
Under conditions, the revision tree is shown vertically shifted so that the "balls" are on the row boundaries, instead of centered in the row.

This does not happen on every machine / for every user.

I believe the common factor is that this occurs when a Windows Remote Desktop is used.

The issue appears in the (now) current version 1.9.6.2 and was first observed several months ago also in earlier versions.
fields.summary: revision tree is shifted vertically
zcz

I selected a file to stage from "unstaged files" section, then clicked stage selected, it showed the "Staging files" dialog with a big greyed overlay on top of the normal screen, and the "staging files" dialog showed a big pre-selected Close button.

The bug is: hitting enter key triggers the commit button under the overlay rather than the Close on the dialog. Esc key should to the same: close the dialog (I would expect)

 

!image-2016-11-18-11-50-37-722.png!

This is not the correct behaviour, I would expect as all other applications (and this worked in the 1.8.x releases) that only one entry is present at time.

fields.description:
About every few seconds, SourceTree creates a spree of git processes in the background usually in 4 or more subtrees.

This might be related to [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/135507/sourcetree-painfully-slow]

I've disabled:
 * "Automatically refresh" in the git repository
 * "Refresh remote status in the background" in the git repository
 * "Refresh automatically when files change" in the global options
 * "Check remotes for updates" in the global options

I'm at SourceTree 1.9.6.1 on Windows 7 x64.

The processes make the 4 core system use ~60% of CPU on average slowing down my work.

Example screenshot:

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/hm9xg1yjbr2yvlb/Screenshot%202016-11-17%2013.10.51.png?dl=0]

--jeroen
fields.summary: SourceTree keeps creating truckloads of git processes in the background

fields.summary: Update Embedded Git to v2.10

fields.description: Git has been released to v2.10; it'll be great if Embedded Git follows as well.
fields.summary: Update Embedded Git to v2.10

fields.description:
When pushing to origin without an ssh key, SourceTree prompt for a password. If an invalid password is entered, SourceTree still remember this password and uses it for successive pushes to origin. It is not possible (in that flow) to reenter the correct password. Password is still remembered even if I restart SourceTree. I can no longer use SourceTree to push to that Repo...

 Error message on push is:

 
{code}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags origin master:master
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://Andreax@bitbucket.org/Andreax/puzzleprocessor.git/'
Pushing to https://Andreax@bitbucket.org/Andreax/puzzleprocessor.git

Completed with errors, see above.
{code}
fields.summary: SourceTree remembers invalid password, no possibility to enter a new password

fields.description:
Current situation:From develop branch click on gitflow button and create a new release. After Release branch is created, click on gitflow again and finish release. After release is finished, current branch is master branch.

Expected situation: From develop branch click on gitflow button and create a new release. After Release branch is created, click on gitflow again and finish release. After release is finished, current branch should be develop.

 

From previous versions this was working fine. Now it happens that after release you start to work further and then realize after a couple of commits that you was commiting to master.
fields.summary: Git flow should switch to develop branch after relase (instead it goes to master)

fields.description:
My git repository has a bash script

I pull that on a windows machine with sourcetree and sync it to a linux server.

The script now doesn't work because the lf is now crlf

SourceTree should never convert files of any sort
fields.summary: Auto conversion of line breaks should not happen

fields.description:
How to reproduce?


 Preferably have different remotes added. In Sourcetree, we can right click on remote branch and select 
 Pull [remote branch] into [current branch].
 A wizard opens, to pull merge the remote branch.

Actual result:


 The remote branch that was right clicked, is not selected in the wizard. Oftentimes, the currently locally checked out branch is selected instead. If, you hit OK quickly, nothing happens if your branch was already up to date with tracked remote branch. Also, oftentimes, in the dropdownlist wrong branches are shown, belonging to a different remote. It is then required to hit "Refresh" first to get the right branches shown.

Expected result:


 The branch that was right clicked should be selected in the wizard. When I click ok, exactly that right clicked branch should be pulled.
fields.summary: Pull [remote branch] into [current branch] opens wizard with wrong branch selected, pull fails

fields.description: Users would like to be able to perform a silent installation of SourceTree in multiple machines.
fields.summary: Allow SourceTree silent installation

fields.summary: Message history (commits) doesn't update until SourceTree is restarted

fields.description:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false revert --no-edit 4a79f2b101d63abedb99e70cf81c029ed4d45978
error: commit 4a79f2b101d63abedb99e70cf81c029ed4d45978 is a merge but no -m option was given.

fields.summary: Unable to stage immediately after selecting a file

fields.description:
TL;DR: If the user.config file gets corrupted, SourceTree 1.9.6.1 will not start.

 

I tried to put details in my question [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/44095261]

 

Copy/pate:

 

My PC (running Win 10 with latest updates) shut down hard from a sudden power off (human error).

I click on the SourceTree icon and it does ... nothing. No message. Just no start. I click on the icon, get the busy symbol for a moment, and nothing.

I did a complete uninstall and install with the latest SourceTree 1.9.6.1 with no change in behavior.

 

I was eventually able to solve the problem with the following (again, copy/paste):

 

I found that the file

 
|\Users\<username>AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree.exe_Url_<randomstring>\1.9.6.1\user.config|

was corrupted. Instead of being full of XML, most of the file was full of zeroes (0x00).

 

I copied the user.config file from the 1.9.6.0 sibling directory. I've lost some settings but SourceTree is working again.
fields.summary: Corrupted user.config file prevents SourceTree from starting.
Remove local branches deleted on remote: git pull --prune

Press F5.

If you switch to the Log/History tab first, then pressing F5 does not crash.

fields.description: I know of a specific change that I can see by opening the file in a text editor. However, in Sourcetree it only shows a small chunk with a minor change, then a large 479 line deletion (screenshot), then I can't scroll down anymore. The chunk with my change is not listed.

fields.description:
I have over 150 different apps, I use SourceTree for these, my problem is I see all my 150 app bookmarks in the left column of source tree but they aren't sorted alphabetically, also I'm able to add duplicate entries.

I'd like it to remove duplicates or at least warn that I'm adding the same folder again.

I'd like to be able to order by Apps alphabetically, then I can easily find the app I'm after, also a search would be good, but I'd consider my number one request to be a simply option to sort alphabetically.

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Add ability to sort Repo by alphabetically order

fields.description: When I editing message during interactive rebase, then after rebase messages have problem with diacritics (instead letters with diacritic are placed question marks). Message is wrong.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase + diacritic in edit message

fields.description:
In the view where you can stage/discard hunks, there are no visual clues which hunk will be affected: The one above or the one below the buttons. This has caused me to multiple times lose code changes due to clicking the wrong buttons.

Screenshot:

!st.jpg!

Look at the first complete hunk shown to the right (with 1 green row). There are buttons both on top and below, and it is anybody's guess which belong to the hunk.

Please add some visual cue here, like a box encircling the hunk+buttons; the current look is very dangerous.
fields.summary: Impossible to see which hunk belongs to "Stage/Discard hunk" buttons

fields.description:
When my repository is located in folder, that have in name folder path [diacritics|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diacritic] (for example ě, š, č, ř, ž, ý, á, í or é), will not start interactive rebase (still is loading – see attach).

In attach I prepared test with and without diacritics in folder name. Rebase children of 28a245c in first test do not execute, in second test is OK.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase + diacritic in folder path

fields.description:
The "_Tools/Options/Refresh automatically when files change"_ global option does not turn off refreshing of file changes in repositories if the dedicated repository options 
_"Repository/Repsitory Settings/Advanced/Automatical refresh"_ is still on.

There is no point in having application-wide setting if its change is irrelevant.

 

Expected behavior:
 * "_Tools/Options/Refresh automatically when files change"_  = off --> overrides all repository refresh settings to off
 * "_Tools/Options/Refresh automatically when files change" = on --> respects repository refresh settings (which are set to on by default)_

 

Further info in thread this has been already discussed: https://answers.atlassian.comiquestions/184935/answers/3362473
fields.summary: Global application setting should override dedicated repository settings
By Modified Date Sort Option For Staged Files

fields.description:
I continually run in to this issue.  It's very annoying, since the only workaround I know is to restart SourceTree.

When I start SourceTree, I am able to do commands like pull, push, stash, commit, etc.  However, if I leave SourceTree running, go about my work, and come back to SourceTree.  Almost inevitably, my next git operation fails.  The way it fails is quite annoying too.  The progress bar just spins continually, and I realize after a few minutes: this pull shouldn't be taking so long, or this push shouldn't be taking so long ... and so I have to hit "cancel" and restart SourceTree.  Then my git command works.  It's almost like there is a timeout or something which kills the ability for the git client to work.

And starting SourceTree with 50 git repositories takes uncomfortably long.  Ideally though, i wouldn't have to restart SourceTree several times a day though, like I have to now.
fields.summary: seem to lose ability to do anything git-wise after some timeout

fields.description:
Hi,

I'd like to request a feature in source tree to be able to perform actions multiple repositories at one time. The action I'm specifically interested in is pull.

If your application contains multiple repositories and/or you have branches in seperate directories, then currently you have to do them one by one. It would make things easier to be able to select multiple and then pull them all and have sourcetree do them one by one programmatically.

Cheers,

Tom
fields.summary: Multi-repository actions
Add the feature to order alphabetically the Bookmarks panel (list of repositories at left column).

fields.description:
{quote}Since git-lfs only supports http/https, git will need to authenticate over http/https when pushing files, even if you are using ssh/git protocol for git. Without the credential helper, you will be asked to enter your username and password for EVERY connection, which is pretty unusable.
{quote}
[https://github.com/github/git-lfs/wiki/Tutorial#credential-cachingstorage]

 

Hence, it will be best that {{credential.helper}} is configured on Embedded Git as default settings on SourceTree.
fields.summary: Include credential.helper as default configuration (Embedded Git)

fields.description: Menu entry "Frequently Asked Questions" in "Help" menu leads me to "https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/faq", which tells me "Sorry, the page you're looking for cannot be found".
fields.summary: Broken link in Help Menu

Ожидаемый Результат:Нулевые значения не должны быть добавлены или выдаватся ошибка заполнения полей

fields.description: simply add the Keyboard shortcut for this very usable item
fields.summary: Keyboard shorcuts for "Show in Explorer" action

fields.description:
Can you allow text boxes that need to scroll horizontally, to do so when holding SHIFT and scrolling the mouse wheel?

On the OS X version of SourceTree, the text boxes that exceed with width of its parent container can be scrolled horizontally using the mouse/trackpad.

On Windows, there is no mouse mechanism for doing this (even the "tilt" feature on some mouse's middle buttons does not work). If SHIFT+mouse wheel functionality were added, SourceTree would behave similar to how web browsers handle too-wide-to-fit text boxes.
fields.summary: Shift-scrollwheel for horizontal text scroll

fields.description:
When using a dual-monitor set-up (in my case, the monitors have different resolutions), maximising or snapping the SourceTree main window by dragging it to the edge of the screen produces a corrupt UI.

To reproduce:
 # Configure a system which has two monitors of different screen resolutions.
 # Configure Windows 10 to extend the desktop onto the second screen.
 # Start SourceTree.
 # Drag the title bar to the top of one of the screens. Windows will then maximise the window.
 # Sometimes (varies between 1-in-10 to 2-in-3 times), the window will appear corrupted, as in the screenshot attached.
 # Clicking on various UI elements in the corrupted mode causes some of the UI to be displayed correctly, but not all.
 # Restoring the window and (optionally) maximising using the maximise button resolves the problem.

This issue* does not* occur under the following circumstances:
 * When only one monitor is connected.
 * When Windows is set to only display on one monitor.
 * When the maximise button is used, rather than the action of dragging to the top of the screen.

This issue *also* occurs under the following circumstances:
 * When duplicating rather than extending monitors.
 * When dragging the window to the side of a screen, to snap to half the screen.
 * When using the keyboard shortcuts (WinKey + arrow) to move the windows.
fields.summary: Main window gets corrupted when maximising/snapping in dual-monitor configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users may sometimes accidentally delete their stashes. Additionally, they may delete the wrong stash due to this bug in SourceTree:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-2360

h3. Suggested Solution
It's possible to recover deleted stashes from command line, however it would be useful to be able to do so from SourceTree as well.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to recover deleted stashes in SourceTree

fields.description:
Files to be committed (in File Pane) or file that have been committed (in Log / History pane) are cut off an not visible. In addition there is no tool tip that would reveal the full name.

 

In previous version a horizontal scroll bar helped to view the full file name.

 

It is impossible to get a quick overview of the file currently worked on.

 

It would be great to restore the previous behaviour (horizontal scroll bar) and to have tool tips showing the full file name.
fields.summary: Files names in File Status and Log / History are are cut off

fields.description:
When having multiple tabs open the width of the tabs is always constant and thus the repository names are cut off (even if there was enough space to actually display them).

 

This leads to a situation where I cannot differentiate the repos anymore as they are all beginning with the same prefix, eg. Company.Component.Category1, Company.Component.Category2, Company.Component.Category3.

 

An easy solution to this would be to display the full repo name in the title bar (as other programmes are doing this as well).
fields.summary: Repository names are cut off in tabbed view
login page not working

fields.description:
It's very helpful to know which branches and tags a commit is contained in.

For example, every time I deploy my code, a tag is added to the deployed commit, so to know if a commit is deployed or not, I need to know if the current 'deployed' tag is contains it.

The git commands to display this information are:

 
{code}
git branch -a --contains HASH
git tag -a --contains HASH
{code}
 

GitExtensions shows this information when displaying a commit's info, but I can't see a way to do that in SourceTree.
fields.summary: Show which branches and tags a commit is contained in

fields.description:
When Deleting a file, or Discarding the changes (choosing not to stage it):

The is a confirmation dialog which pops up. 

Now, your older versions default was "OK", while this version default is "cancel"

when working without a mouse, this is somewhat annoying. This is a developers tool and I think it is better to assume we know what we are doing :)
fields.summary: Default option of "confirm Discard" and "Confirm Delete"

fields.description: Some time, the botton "stage" work - but the stagin isn't shown - meaning the satged file is still shown under the unstaged list. If I close and open the source tree again - the file then appears on the right list.
fields.summary: Staging view got ruined

fields.description:
When "fetching" from all branches, there used to be an "arrow down" symbol next to the branch name which uses to indicate that a branch has advanced. 

It is now gone (doesn't work) and the branch itself doesn't show the new versions that I know for sure exist.
fields.summary: Status of branches does not update after "fetch"

fields.description:
On the split-view for the commit stage, you can select individual change lines and then click "stage lines" or "discard lines".  However you cannot stage if the lines selected are not contiguous.

 

This is very nice for "cherry picking" specific lines to commit but often these lines are not contiguous.  

 

Similarly, sometimes you want to shift-select a range of lines that includes a few lines that didn't change, and then stage or discard them.  You cannot currently do this - the selection must only include changed lines.

 

Since "select line" usually is only used for a few lines at a time, one possible solution would be to iterate across each line in the patch and add them one by one, while also skipping non-changed lines.
fields.summary: Allow "stage lines" and "discard lines" for non-contiguous selections and non-changed lines

fields.description:
When performing a shift-select of multiple lines of code to add to the stage, if you select from bottom to top the last selection line will move downwards 1 row and leave a row blank.

Steps to reproduce:
 #  Change files on disk
 # Go to the commit stage (split-view) and select the file.
 # Select last changed line.
 # Shift-select to top changed line
 # Last selected line will jump
fields.summary: Commit stage: Line selection splays on shift-select

fields.description:
Installing the latest update of Mercurial/TortoiseHg, SourceTree says it can't find the Mercurial binaries, and defaults to use the embedded mercurial.

Trying to specify manually the hg.exe binary it doesn't give any error, but it doesn't change to it either.

 

It is also affecting Mercurial 3.7.3
fields.summary: It's not possible to use Mercurial 4.0 with SourceTree

fields.description: Consistently I need to attempt operations like checking out a branch 3 times.  The first two times fail because there was an index lock.  This lock didn't prexist even though the GUI advises that maybe there was some crash.  I have opened the .git folder and watched the lock file get created as I try to check out a branch and then the error appears and the lock file goes away.  It seems to be some timing issue.  It's weird that like 90% of the time it takes 3 tries.  Occasionally less, sometimes more.
fields.summary: Index locked on first 2 attempts to checkout branch
Configuration error

fields.description: When moving folder in bookmarks tab the folder itself and its content ir removed from list.
fields.summary: When reorganizing folders in bookmarks tab items are removed

fields.description:
I try to clone a repository from Team Services (former Visual Studio online), but I receive the following error:

System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the file specified
 FATAL ERROR: Server sent disconnect message
 type 2 (protocol error)
 "Invalid packet"

I'm using Putty, I double-checked - the correct SSH key is loaded. SSH access to my BitBucket account using the same key is working. Another Git application (GitExtensions) works with this key and this repository. I tried several repositories from different Team Services accounts and the same error appears on all of them.
fields.summary: Not working with Team Services (former Visual Studio Online) via SSH

fields.description: When using sourcetree some of toolbar buttons text labels will disappear.
fields.summary: Toolbar labels partially disappear sometimes

fields.description: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
fields.summary: Error after install and connect to my account

fields.description:
When I look at diffs in the Uncommitted changed view or in the log, I often want to copy a few lines to my clipboard to use in my code. Currently this is not possible thus I have to resort to external diff tools.

Also it'd be nice if the diff view did not cut off at 100 lines, rather make this value customizable (or at least increase it to 1000 or something). I can assure you that most of us have good PCs.
fields.summary: Allow to select text in the diff view

fields.description:
I usually use source tree for win, but sometimes sourcetree doesnt show the texts of icons in toolbar, like this:
 !image-2016-11-01-15-45-04-181.png|thumbnail! 

I'm using version 1.9.6.1
fields.summary: Sometimes the texts of icons in toolbar gone

fields.description: When adding large amount of files to source control, the window displayed is too large. This causes inability to see the options at the bottom of the window.
fields.summary: When adding large amount of files to source control, the window displayed is too large.

fields.description:
On the Log/History tab in SourceTree, when I select a file to see its diff, I often see the diffs of previous files I selected as well. Usually the previous ones are on the top, so this is confusing because I don't see the display change as I expect and I think I didn't seelct the file I wanted. It is then frustrating that I need to scroll down to see the file diff I want. Also, I have no way to remove the previous diffs. Sometimes they go away if I reselect the file and the select a new one, but come back if I move between the Staged pane and Unstaged pane. 

Also, if I select a file, then collapse the tree it is in, and select a new file, the old file does not get unselected. I have to expand the tree, in order for it to get unselected. See the attachment for this example.
fields.summary: Cannot get rid of previous internal diff

fields.description:
When scrolling Source Tree code pane, the code becomes suddenly blurry.
Once the scrolling is stopped it becomes clear after couple of seconds.
The blurriness makes me feel nausea and I would prefer to see clear code while scrolling.
fields.summary: Scrolling screen becomes blurred
asdasd

fields.description:
I have big problem with textfile, which have other encoding than UTF-8.

Although I set in repository _.git/config_ file correctly {code}encoding = cp1250{code}, but chars are displaying wrong in SourceTree (in original GIT GUI is OK). Simultaneously I can not STAGE or UNSTAGE hunk of code, because error. (in GIT GUI all in OK).
fields.summary: Problem with encoding

fields.description:
Hello,

When having many unstaged files in the list, the unstaged files appear in a disturbing order.
 * Given many files that exist in 2 different directories (A and B)
 * When I want to stage only the files from one directory (A)
 * Then it's a pain to select them and hit "stage selected" because the files are not sorted by their path. Instead, they are interleaved in the list. I have to carefully select a particular chunk, stage it, then restart again with a new (different) interleaved list.

It's a problem because:
 * it take times to locate and add all the files of a particular directory
 * it's *very* easy to add by accident one single other file from another dir

 A simple solution would be to sort this list before displaying it.
fields.summary: Sort Unstaged files list

fields.description:
When selecting a stash, its diffs of changes are shown, but when a line is selected in the diff, it can't be copied.

Expected behavior would be the same as in normal (commit) diff.
fields.summary: Copy in diff on a stash does not work

fields.description: While checking for updates from "refresh remote status", even if i have many pulls graph does not show it.
fields.summary: Graph does not update when check for update from "refresh remote status"

fields.description:
With the litany of regressive usability updates in recent releases I firmly believe the developers (or at least those in charge of features and planing) don't use the product in any significant way.

Here is a brief list of regressive bugs.

* Can not perform actions on folders in tree view.
* Expanding folders in staged tree view unstages files
* Colpasing folders in staged view after expanding leaves index.lock file for manual cleanup
* Missing checkboxes for staging files
* UI does not refresh to file modifications reliably
* stage hunk button disappears when selecting lines in unstaged files.
* ignore whitespace does not ignore zero-width characters
* Selecting multiple lines in staged hunk results in off by one error in line highlights.
* zero-width characters in commit message causes ui halt
fields.summary: Have developers use product for source control

fields.description:
Per STSP-5244:

"For cloning and pushing Repositories with Bitbucket Server (as well as LFS), User-Session will be verified with existing Cookies.
How can we configure SourceTree with embedded git, to set/get Cookies?"

We currently do not have this ability, so this ticket is for research.

Follow-up:

"we use Bitbucket and also Sourcetree behind a appliance for authentification and ssl offloading.
The company policy is that this appliance must validate every http user (also souretree/git client) e.g. we must accept access (for selected customer) via internet.

A none lfs push needs here 3 separate requests and so 3 times a validation because the only way to prevent revalidation is a cookie to remember the client. On a lfs push we fail because the lfs client will not send username/password on a PUT.

The second possible way to do persistence via source address is not possible because we must support proxy access where many users sharing one ip
So at this time we have a lot of overhead with none lfs and we are unable to use the lfs client."
fields.summary: Enable using Cookies in SourceTree with embedded git

fields.description:
when I copied a URL for cloning in Source Tree, it is stated under Repository Type that "This is not a valid source path/URL", but when I click "details", nothing is displayed in the pop-up. I am very certain that the URL I used is a valid one because it is a URL provided by our instructor at a coding class and everyone else managed to use it alright. (The URL I used was: https://github.com/code61/learning_html.git)  I have tried reinstalling Source Tree and have also downloaded GitHub, but problem persists. 

I have attached a screenshot of the problem. 
It will be greatly appreciated if you could help me to solve this problem.
fields.summary: Invalid URL

fields.description:
If I select the file content of a file with SHIFT and the second click is above the first selection click, I get an empty line.

If the selection end (second click) is below the first selection click, everything is selected and the correct behavior.

Here is a gif to demonstrate the issue:

 

!http://i.imgur.com/KhNSLBP.gif!

 

The selection index goes one down.
fields.summary: Shift Selection of file content in File Status has an unselected line
GUI loses some labels

fields.description: The UI becomes unresponsive for 8 seconds when I try to activate the tab for a different repository or when I try to activate the File Status tab (to write a commit message). It's been happening for a long time now, so I upgraded SourceTree today, but that didn't work so I'm reporting it now. It's particularly disruptive to an ADHD workflow.
fields.summary: It takes 8 seconds to switch repositories or to go from File / History to File Status

fields.description:
This started quite a while back, but since I can highlight the row and use the space bar to "check" the missing box I didn't want to take the time to report it. Recently a new performance issue started, so today I upgraded and the issues were not resolved so I'm taking the time to report both now.

This missing checkbox issue occurs on the Log / History tab and the File Status tab
fields.summary: Check boxes missing from Staged files and Unstaged files lists
Dialog says to click 'No', but there isn't a 'No' button
Dialog says to answer 'No', but there isn't a 'No' button

fields.description:
Sometimes it's hard to find commits in the graph view because the only way to find those commits is to keep scrolling until you see it. The Ancestor Order is very helpful in this regard, but it has some limitations. For example, finding the commit where a branch was branched from is not possible, even with Ancestor Order view. At the same time, there may be use cases where the user wants to look at the Date Order view, but wants to navigate the commits only in the current branch. This is a common scenario when looking at multiple branches and trying to figure out when commits were made across multiple branches in relation to each other.

I propose adding another keyboard shortcut, in addition to the current UP and DOWN buttons that would navigate commits *only in the current branch*, until it makes it to the point where the branch was first created, and then follow the parent branch commits.
{code:java}
a---b---c  // branch child
         \
--x---y---d---o---o---o---o // branch parent


{code}
In this above repository, the graph would be able to walk commits [ a, b, c, d, ... ], whereas currently it is only able to walk commits in the global order [ a, x, b, y, c, d, ... ].
fields.summary: Improve graph navigation

fields.description:
The commit button is often grayed out and I have to restart the application to re-enable it.

I have tried multiple ways to re-enable the button such as changing the view (going to the commit list and back to working copy), closing the repo tab and re-opening it, the only way I know how to enable it back is to restart the application.
fields.summary: Commit button is grayed out

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Select files to stage
 # Hit the "Stage Selected" button
 # Hit Ctrl + Shift + C to start editing the commit message
 # Nothing...
fields.summary: Commit All shortcut (Ctrl + Shift + C) does not work after pressing "Stage Selected"

fields.description:
We using Sourcetree 1.9.6.1 with embedded git 2.8.1
with Bitbucket v4.6.2.

When we "fetch from origin" then the remote tree often show all Branches in subfolders
you have to colapse
 !2016-10-26_08h20_48.png|thumbnail! 
 your subfolder first and then expand it again then sourcetree renders all subfolder branches.
fields.summary: Remote Tree doesnt show all Subfolder Branches

fields.description:
We using Sourcetree 1.9.6.1 with embedded git 2.8.1 !2016-10-26_08h14_24.png|thumbnail! 
 with Bitbucket v4.6.2.
When we deleting and Branch in Bitbucket und clicking "Fetch from Origin" !2016-10-26_08h11_54.png|thumbnail!  then the deleted Branch already exists.

You get only an realistic Origin-View when you delete your local repository and clone it fresh.
fields.summary: Remote Tree doesnt remove branches

fields.description: I am unable to commit a dll of 48MB to my repository. It doesn't even show up in the files area.
fields.summary: Cannot commit large files

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add some indication that the difference between a working file and the checked in version is just whitespace? 
With 'Ignore whitespace' set using the cog at the top right, files are shown in 'Pending' but only a grey block appears in the right panel.
This is not incorrect behaviour but it caused me confusion because I had forgotten about 'Ignore whitespace' (or maybe it's the default?) and it was not clear to me why ST was showing a pending file with no diffs. 
I think would be helpful to put a label underneath the filename with text something like 'Only whitespace changes in this file' if there are no other changes and 'ignore whitespace' is set.
Thanks.
fields.summary: Whitespace-only changes in internal diff viewer
